metadata.title: CVE-2021-3492 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
Shiftfs, an out-of-tree stacking file system included in Ubuntu Linuxkernels, did not properly handle faults occurring during copy_from_user()correctly. These could lead to either a double-free situation or memory notbeing freed at all. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service(kernel memory exhaustion) or gain privileges via executing arbitrary code.AKA ZDI-CAN-13562.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.3.0-73-generic - 5.3.0-73.69
linux-image-5.3.0-73-lowlatency - 5.3.0-73.69
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-73-generic - 5.3.0-73.69
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-73-lowlatency - 5.3.0-73.69
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-1042-gke - 5.3.0-1042.45
No subscription required

No subscription required
